org.usfirst.frc.team5002.drive

Interface Drive

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SwerveDrive

    public interface Drive
    The base interface for all drivetrains. This file should not be implemented directly. Instead, implement a specialized interface, such as SwerveDrive. If one does not exist for your drivetrain, create your own interface extending this base interface and implement that one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void driveDistance(float power, int degrees)
      Drive a certain distance at a given speed.
      void setDrive(float power)
      Begin driving at a specific speed.
      void setTurn(float power)
      Set the turning speed.
      boolean stopped()
      Check whether all motors on the drivetrain are stopped or if there are still tasks being executed.
      void turnDistance(float power, int degrees)
      Turn a certain distance at a given speed.

    • Method Detail

      • setDrive

        void setDrive(float power)
        Begin driving at a specific speed.
        Parameters:
        power - The speed and direction of the motor: expressed as a percentage of maximum power between -1 and +1, with 0 being a complete stop.

      • driveDistance

        void driveDistance(float power,
                   int degrees)
        Drive a certain distance at a given speed.
        Parameters:
        power - See setSpeed() above.
        degrees - The number of degrees on the encoder to drive.

      • setTurn

        void setTurn(float power)
        Set the turning speed.
        Parameters:
        power - How fast to turn. -1 indicates full speed counter-clockwise rotation, 0 indicates no rotation, and +1 indicates full speed clockwise rotation.

      • turnDistance

        void turnDistance(float power,
                  int degrees)
        Turn a certain distance at a given speed.
        Parameters:
        power - See setTurn() above.
        degrees - The number of degrees to turn the chassis based on gyroscope data.

      • stopped

        boolean stopped()
        Check whether all motors on the drivetrain are stopped or if there are still tasks being executed.
        Returns:
        true if the drive train is completely stopped, false otherwise.
